and various other islands in the Amami archipelago.

value: content=Rent a scooter or motorbike and just cruise around the island to admire it's beautiful nature and discover tiny beaches where you can hop off and go for a swim. The best way to travel on Amami Oshima.
directions=When you leave the ferry, take a right and follow the road. It's 30 meters past the Shell station and motorbike shop to your left. Look for the usual red lantern outside.

content=This place is ideal if you have to wait for the ferry or if you have a big appetite coming from the ferry. You get great value for your money (1500 yen/person) with a starter (e.g. sashimi), your own little stone grill with chicken, salad, boiled beef, rice, etc; and a dessert. Friendly, local atmosphere.

directions=Toen is a small village near the sea. The Westerners Café is located on the main road crossing the village, right before leaving the village. It's a bright red, little box, you can't miss it.
price=350 for a coffee or tea

content=This little café by the road is owned by two retired people from Kobe who are mad about cowboys. The little place is filled with pictures, paintings and all kinds of stuff referring to the glorious times of the Wild West. The owner, dressed as a real cowboy, will gladly receive you. They serve two kinds of (freshly ground) coffee and Indian tea. Relaxed on-the-road atmosphere.

Visitors should be aware of the Habu snake. A venomous pit viper that inhabits roughly 70% of the island.

When diving, swimming or snorkeling at the various beaches watch out for sea urchins lying on the sea floor.
